Reviews.Title: “Stay well away”
Reviews.Author: peter w
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days Feb 2012. Horrible place. There was no heating and i had to sleep in my coat to keep warm as they only provid two thin sheets on the bed (which is an old fold up spring mattress) The tv only has a few italian, arab and indian channels so being english that was no good for me and it went of on the last last day. there was no cup or glass to drink out of. There was no soap provided when we arrived and the cleaner left us only one towel for the two of us. The traffic outside can be heard day and night and they blast there horns at anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Alfredo - SJCampos - Brazil”
Reviews.Author: AlfredoCPereira
Reviews.Content: Adequate for one night in transit. Location next to Termini Station is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Never ever”
Reviews.Author: JL42
Reviews.Content: Arrived, found the after a while as the marking is not the best. Two facilities with separate entrance in one building. The receptionist told us they cancelled our reservation as they have a group of children they had to accomodate. Even if we had confirmation and paid reservation fee. Of course, they didn't let us know. They offered us a room in their "dependency". In reality, it was a horible noisy room in a house close to Termini station with neighbours partying in the common corridor. Instead of a breakfast, we got a voucher for a croisant and a cup of cofee in a cafe downstairs. We luckily found a proper hotel in the vincinty but have to argue about substracting the reservation fee from the price for a single night.

Reviews.Title: “bad service”
Reviews.Author: cuceucojan
Reviews.Content: We booked 4 days in Rome and Serendipity was a good choice,looking from the outside;I understand that the building is old,and they(owner)cannot do much about it;But there are lot sof things that CAN be fixed;shower was not draining properly,remote control was not working,BRAKFAST was a big joke-a coffee and ONE piece of pastry-that is not breakfast,and served outside the premisses.NOT recommended,or at least not for this price!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place to Stay Near Train Station”
Reviews.Author: iceskating
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay for a night to catch a train for the next day and this place fit the bill. It is very close to the train station and even though the area is not the nicest, it feels very safe and is gated with video cameras. The room was very clean and looked liked it had been renovated recently. Really nice bathroom and little balcony. The staff did not speak much English at all but they were nice and helpful. The biggest negetive is that this place is hard to find at night and they don't give very good directions. Take these instructions with you if you go: Basically, from the train station, you should exit the station doors on the right hand side onto Via Marsala. Turn Right onto Via Marsala, then left onto Via Castro Pretorio. Now here's the tricky part. The hotel is on Viale Castro Pretorio (not Via) Via Castro Pretorio becomes Viale Castro Pretorio so keep walking down Via until it becomes Viale at the stoplight. At the stoplight, contine straight, you will see a big sign for Hotel Enrico-this is where you want to go as Serendipity is in the same building. Simply buzz at the gate and they will let you in. Would recommend staying here if you need to be close to the train station. Would not recommend if you are vacationing in Rome for a couple days-stay somewhere closer to the sites. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: j_jenny26
Reviews.Content: This hotel should not has a name as "hotel"... Fiestly, you shoul not believe in this hotel website, because all photos are not real. Only facade of Serendipity is really nice, but all thing inside are horrible. recweption is in the same building but not in the same staircase!!! So... to get to the rooms, you have to go ONLY by stairs on the 3rd level. There is a lift but from early 80s and does not work. At room you have beds which in fact are big mattress (when I seat on one, everything collapsed, because one leg of this bed was not fixed at all !!!). In the bathroom there was one BIG, horrible fungus just around the shower, so like that I could not take shower during 3 days!!! In the room you have only blanket and bed linen.To eat the breakfast you have to go outside from the hotel and go to another street (2min walk), and there is small bar in which you can eat simple sandwich, crossant and drink tea or coffe- thats all. I defenetely not recommend this hotel ( or only for them who do not care of fungi, derties and do not need shower)

Reviews.Title: “Hostile disguised as a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kellychoice
Reviews.Content: Just recently got back from my first trip to Paris. I traveled with a friend and had a wonderful time and decided on settling on this location for my last night prior to my departure back to the U.S. Finding this "hotel" was the first problem. There is no clear signage and is located on a major corner with other businesses and hotels. The location was close to the Termini (main subway station in Rome) but was in a very dangerous part of town with other low end hotels. After a long day of traveling from Venice, I entered the gates and could tell from the get go that this was not what was advertised on TripAdvisor. Fear was my first reaction since the courtyard is extremely dark and, as I mentioned, hotel is located in a not so nice part of town. I got to the reception area and was greeted by a young man that said that he had been trying to get a hold of me on my cell phone wondering where I was at. It was 7:30 p.m. and I had emailed the hotel a week in advance (and they acknowledged receiving it) that I would be there approximately 7:00 p.m. The hotel attendant then proceeded to tell me that my hotel was actually in another building and that he needed to know right away how I was going to pay for the hotel since he would be departing immediately for the evening and that there is NO hotel attendants during the night for anything, including emergencies. Only phone numbers are posted in hallways in case an emergency occurs. After lugging my suitcases up a elevator that fit only myself and one suitcase at a time, we finally found our room which was sparse to say the least and very disgusting. The beds were actually cots. I found two fleas immediately on my bed and there were several mosquitos flying around since the windows had been kept open. My friend was bitten 5 times during the night by them and I was bitten twice. The bathrooms were also disgusting with only 1/2 role of toilet paper provided for two people and no way to get additional supplies. The hotel smelled of mold. I chose not to take a shower since I felt cleaner than getting in a disgusting stall that obviously hadn't had a good cleaning in quite some time. We looked into getting something else immediately after entering the room but since it was a Friday evening and late, we could not find anywhere and had to depart for flights 9 hours after arriving anyway so we decided to stick it out. The only upside to this location was that the front desk did reserve a taxi for us early the next morning (which arrived on time) and we were able to depart this disaster before the hotel attendant arrived for the morning shift at 8:00 a.m. I highly recommend AGAINST this place and continue to be baffled by the reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, basic services”
Reviews.Author: elche74
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights, and we were satisfied. The on-line booking was simple and it worked. The distance from the Termini is 5 mins by foot, and the 492 bus stops directly at the hotel- it goes to the Vatican city and it's passes by Pantheon, Fontana di Trevi, etc. The nearest metro station is close too. It wasn't easy to locate the Serendipity, at the gate I found its name amongst the residents and after pushing the button the gate opened. The reception and the rooms were in different buildings, and the reception is not 0-24 hours, the guys there are only between 8-20. We arrived later but I wrote it on the booking form so they waited us. The check-in was OK, they told me how would we find the room- it was a bit tricky. The room was OK, with a larger and a smaller bed, SAT TV (even with a Hungarian channel), A/C, mini bar, small safe, large bath. Everything was tidy, but in the bath they should fix a few things. I found Wi-Fi signal but didn't know the password, and didn't found anybody in the reception at 19.45 to ask. The window looked to the street which was noisy, but the good windows reduced it. The breakfast is not in the residence but in a close bar, it consists of a cake, a coffee and a juice. Not too much but good for starting the day. So we liked the location and the services, the price was OK as well.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked that place”
Reviews.Author: JohnAth
Reviews.Content: Its a very nice place to stay in Rome! Very good Value for Money and very friendly service! Ricardo the owner was very friendly and helpful too! The hotel is in a big building and there rooms in different floors. Its renewed and very well equipped. It is very closed to the Termini Station and i would sure come back in my next stay in Rome!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place..a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: poetrygirl41
Reviews.Content: Having been to Rome before, I have had the opportunity to stay in various locations, but certainly Serendipity surpassed my expectations. The staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. As for the location, it is situated just a few blocks from Termini and incredibly convenient. I was so happy with the hotel that I actually stayed two weeks for the first part of my vacation, and followed it up with another wk at this hotel before leaving for America. When I return in the spring, it will be my first choice. Do not hesitate to book this hotel. It really is all that the ads claim it to be.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value (with minor oddities)”
Reviews.Author: jdwiegman
Reviews.Content: Pros -Very friendly service/owners -Delicious breakfast (traditional Italian - pastry, cappucino and juice) -Free WiFi! Cons -Not easy to find the first time -Very sketchy about taking credit cards... provide different excuses. I think they are trying to save the service fees -Blanket in bed was very worn/tattered... I wouldn't use it at the beach/camping All in all, I would recommend this place and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Personal Touch”
Reviews.Author: drorab
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Rome for the Weekend when I lost my Passport… Ricardo, the owner immediately phoned the last place I've been and asked them to look for it… while printing out the address, phone and fax numbers of my embassy. Then we hopped on his motorcycle and he drove me to the embassy (scary ride..). You can't get this kind of service at a five star hotel. The hotel itself is immaculately clean. Good mattress. Fridge, cable TV, hair-dryer and air-conditioning that actually works. A court-yard keeps the place quiet four blocks from Termini. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great management”
Reviews.Author: claudiaS_oPaulo
Reviews.Content: serendipity is not a hotel is a residence, there is no phone in the room, and they will not necessarily take the message if someone calls, but other than that, they are great (I don´t need a phone in the room, and when I on vacation I don´t care who calls me!)! The room is clean and nice, the bed is confortable, and there´s a bathroom. In the front desk Anna will help you with everything you need, she is fantastic and the rest of the staff is also very nice. The breakfast is in a caffeteria nearby and Giovanni has the best cappucino in Rome (seriously, if you like a very creamy cappucino this is the place), the whole family works here and they are great, the pastries are wonderfull (try all the cornetti flavors). For what you pay it is totally worth it. My husband and I loved it. Ana and Fabio

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: loyloy
Reviews.Content: Located 12 mins away from the Train terminal, this was one of the 2 hotels we stayed at in Rome. The rooms were clean, average in space, the beds were firm and there is access via a small lift that fits 2 person and 2 pieces of luggage exactly. Though located near the train station, it is on the quieter side of the terminal so both the neighbourhood and the scenery is more local (especially since a local university is a few mins walk away). Breakfast is at Bar Jolly 3 mins walk around the corner from the hotel with a friendly Bar owner. We would have returned to this hotel again when we came back to Rome for our flight out of Italy, if not for the fact that we were on a very early morning flight and we wanted to be very very near the terminal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: RomanWG
Reviews.Content: The room is located a 5 minute walk from Termini station, and a 20-30 minute walk to the Coliseum/Forum. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was a little sparse, but was large, clean, and had a private bath/shower with TV. The breakfast place was around the corner, but the owner there was quite friendly as well. Not the place to go for luxury accomodations, but, in my opinion, an exceptional deal for under 50 euros a night.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: KentMissPiggy
Reviews.Content: Serendipity is a wonderful hotel that is incredibly good value for money. Situated in a very handy location, approx 5 mins from Termini Station and short walking distance to many good cafes and restaurants. The hotel feels very secure, and the rooms were always kept pristine. Breakfast was good, with fresh local produce regularly brought in. Drinks facilities were not available in the rooms, but the attendant upon reception 24 hours a day was always willing to make us a drink free of charge upon request. The staff are always friendly and willing to lend a hand. Will be looking here again for my next holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: aeronaut
Reviews.Content: Whether you arrive from Ciampino(Terravisionbus) or Fiumicino (Leonardo Da Vinci express) airport- hotel is very easy to find. Out right from Termini- up via Marghera. At end you look right and see the big yellow building- very easy to find. Yes there is a main way to cross to get there- in Rome drivers do not know what these white lines are, so you just need to go and they have to stop. Thats the way in Roma. Arriving through the gate turn left and you will find reception desk. I was greeted by smiling and very helpful staff - did feel very welcome at all times. The tv-thingy was a bit difficult for me to find out, staff came to my room and helped me. My room (301) was on the 3rd floor in the next building (big single or small double), clean, big bathroom, small showercabin, a tiny balcony with view to the yard. A good standard room for Roma. Aircon did work perfectly. Notes on Serendipity: 1) There are few rooms next to the reception area (ground floor), the rest is situated in neigbour building on the 3rd floor. 2) Elevators are tiny (very common in European cities)- and you need to remember to close all doors in order for the next arriving guests to use it!!!! It is noted in the cabin it self in several languages. 3) The rooms does not have phones- so if you need help or need to contact the staff, you need to go down by elevator/stairs and find the reception. 4) Breakfast is not served at the residence itself- you need to go out and cross the busy street in order to get your coffee. I did not try it- so can not comment on standards. 5) When situated near a main trainstation you meet all kinds of people- a few homeless people etc. Would not consider this area as seedy. No worries. 6) as you probably know, Rome is incredibly expensive- if you need to buy water etc. Get out at Termini, turn right and you will find a SPAR-supermarket (Called DeSpar in Italy). 7)Termini Station- here you find many thing in food, newspapers, shopping and transportation to airports. Just in front of maindoors you will find busses, Metro and sightseeing coaches. I do recommend The Serendipity Residence for its great location, decent rooms and rates. For a Huge city inwaded by tourists everyday- I think service was good and friendly. Would you like the city- i have no idea, either you do or dont- but rome is Rome and you need to see it at least 1 time in your life:-)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the $ and very close to Termini train station”
Reviews.Author: chaspat
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at Serendipity. The room was very large for European standards and even had a terrace where I enjoyed my morning coffee. The overall condition of the room was about average and the staff were definitely a cut above in terms of friendliness and hospitality. The hotel is centrally located and accessible by foot in less than 10 minutes from the Termini train station. I left my luggage in the care of the person at reception on my final day and had no problems upon my return some 10 hours later. My only complaint would be the breakfast that was provided. It was a bit meager, but then again, I would never judge a budget hotel by its breakfast. For the price, I would definitely stay here again and recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a moderately priced convenient hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, good location”
Reviews.Author: Annie_chelle
Reviews.Content: We were very happy to be greeted with a bottle of water, and were pleasantly suprised when shown to our room. Our expectations had been pretty low, but the room was quite big (especially the bathroom), and clean. My first comment was "if this is the worst place we stay on this trip, we'll be doing OK". We found the location great. About a 10 min stroll to the train station. We found some pretty good places to eat near here (can't remember the names, sorry). Coffee machine in the hotel wasn't working when we were there, but there are plenty of places around for coffee. Unless you are on a very strict budget, don't bother trying the breakfast, it was decidedly below average. All in all, we were happy with this hotel, and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good bet near Termini station”
Reviews.Author: Mike78
Reviews.Content: Picked this place because it is near to the station. It's about a 10 minute walk. Often the area around the station isn't so nice, but the location of the serendipity was quite nice. The room was quite big, very clean but the decor was average. We didn't have any problem with the lift (elevator) - I think what the previous poster encountered must have been people failing to close the door when they leave the lift (it's an old-style lift where you open and close the door yourself). Reception is 24 hour and very friendly and helpful. They made a dinner reservation for us. If you need a fairly reasonably priced (for Rome) place near the station then it is a good bet, but we will probably try another place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Okay hotel, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Bazilu
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Rome (end of October) with a week stay at this hotel. I guess I might stay there again (very nice staff); however, some things to note: [1] Although very close to the train station (about 5 blocks away), it was across a busy road (not what I would consider a "highway" as written in another post), and if you come at night, you better know what the hotel looks like since there are no signs that give its location; [2] The internet is free (in 15 minute increments); however, you have to go down the street to an internet cafe to use it. Although it is on the way to the train station, it was quite inconvenient since you could only use it during their hours of operation, and you had to schedule your internet use around them; and [3] The breakfast area was off site too. Across this busy intersection (especially during rush hour). The price was great and the room clean.

Reviews.Title: “No coffee!”
Reviews.Author: MamaCissy
Reviews.Content: We were very skeptical when we arrived at this hotel. The surrounding area is alittle seedy and not very clean. We entered the gates and were greeted by Vivaldi who is Ricardo's cousin. We were so anxious to sit down and have something to eat or at least a cup of coffee. The coffee maker was broken..... We were shown our room which was spotless and simply appointed. The bed was comfortable. We could hear the lobby TV through the walls and also conversations of the deskman and his friend. When we asked about the breakfast for the next morning we were given a ticket to go across a major highway that was crazy with traffic. When we got to the other side we had to look for this other place where we could eat. We couldn't find the place. We ended up at a little store just to get a cup of coffee. This was a disappointing experience for our last night in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Too Noisy”
Reviews.Author: pericson
Reviews.Content: This hotel had good reveiws, however we were not impressed. We found much better value for moeny elswhere in Rome and Italy. The hotel walls were so thin that we could here people talking all through the night. Our room was located near the reception and bar area, and after several complaints and nothing being done, I asked to move but of course the hotel was fully booked. The main entrance door kept slamming and waking us every time someone entered which did not make us happy considering we had a 6:30am flight out the next morning. Positives are location to Termini, and overall clean hotel. Just make sure you ask for a quiet room away from the reception area.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff!”
Reviews.Author: bubbliegirl526
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! The outside of the building was lovely, with a locked gate to the street, helping with a feeling of safety. As a backpacker, this hotel was very convenient because of its location very close to the major train station. The location was also within walking distance to all the site of Rome, except the Vatican, but the train station is so close and easy to understand, it is a perfect place to be. The quiet location away from the trourists also make it perfect and quiet. The rooms are HUGE for a European hotel and our room had a cute balcony looking over the garden was very romantic. The staff was amazing and very helpful, always willing to go out of their way. If you want a quiet hotel away from the crazy amount of tourists but close to the sites, this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: EuropeVAC07
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff who are more than eager to help with sight seeing in Rome. This hotel was the 3rd on our European vacation and quite a nice one compared to our others. The room was very clean, quiet, and the air conditioning felt wonderful. We walked from Termini train station (which wasn't very far). If we ever travel back to Rome we would stay there again for sure. You never know what you'll get in a hotel room and we were pleasently surprised. I researched this room on Trip Advisor and was happy with the results.

Reviews.Title: “Nice once you get inside to pension!”
Reviews.Author: travelmonkeyjunkie
Reviews.Content: NIce hotel, but outside could do with a bit of a paint job, infact in the whole of Rome could do with a paint job, grafitti has ruined the outside of many buildings not the tourist sights though, but the tourists sights are within easy distance of the this 'hotel'!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, welcoming experience”
Reviews.Author: Opaldog
Reviews.Content: I booked the Serendipity based on reviews I read on TripAdvisor. We arrived at 10:00 pm, coming from a flight at Ciampino. We walked from Termini. It was a 5 block walk and was easy to find. We buzzed in and with a little help from someone else entering, found the entrance. The desk clerk couldn't have been nicer. He immediately brought us some cups of juice and signed us in. The room was right off the lobby area. This was fine as we were only there for 1 night. The room had no view and was small, but was immaculate. There was air conditioning, t.v., good sized bathroom with hot water. My husband was sick with the flu, so we didn't go far for food. The area is not one that I would stay in if I were going to be in Rome for any length of time, but the Serendipity and the people couldn't have been better for our purposes. There was also a breakfast included. I would definitely recommend the Serendipity.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: DaddyB_USA
Reviews.Content: I booked the Serendipity in 2006 for my family's 5 day trip to Rome. Initially skeptical of online reviews and ratings, I was delighted at the fast and friendly email responses to detailed questions about our stay. When we got to Rome Ricardo treated us like family and made the hotel and his gracious spirit one of our best memories of Rome. If you're looking for a cozy and enchanting home-away-from-home where you'll be treated like nowhere else: book this hotel. The rooms are brand new, clean, well appointed, and convenient to the subway with a generous staff at your disposal.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: VaughnB
Reviews.Content: My son and I shared a twin at the Serendipty in February 2007. Even though I booked through Orbitz. Not quite sure what to expect. Other than having trouble finding it since I mixed up Viale and Via, our stay was great. The room was spacious and ensuite. Heat and cooling worked very well. Being a small hotel, noisy guests could be heard but it was reasonable. The facility was SUPER CLEAN. Staff was helpful and knowledgeable. The location is convenient and quiet. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. We paid 70 euro a night which was very good for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jlboston
Reviews.Content: This hotel is 10min walk from Termini but is located in a quiet neighborhood. It is not so easy though to find it as it is in a gated complex. The elevator is very small (2 people at most). The staff speaks very good English and is very friendly and helpful. The room is spartan but well maintained. If you plan on spending most of time sightseeing, this hotel would be a reasonable budget choice.

HotelInfo.Name: Serendipity Residence
HotelInfo.Address: Viale Castro Pretorio 25, 00185 Rome, Italy
